channel.title: C on Grady Berry Ward
channel.description: Recent content in C on Grady Berry Ward

item.description: I wrote my undergraduate thesis on the Graph Isomorphism problem, and within that, the “Paths” invariant, which is incredibly powerful test for discerning between potentially isomorphic graphs in cubic (and fully paralellizable) time. The main findings of my thesis were that: Unlike was theorized by XXX, copaths graphs exist, and finding them is easily done through some mapreduces, or on a GPU. Measuring discriminatory power to value ratio of invariants within graph isomorphism is possible and can help us devise better algorithms for practical isomorphism detection.
